title: C++ Level 5 â€” Arrays & Basic Algorithms
concept: Use arrays to process sequences: indices, neighbors, maxima, uniqueness and counting.

challenges.title: Even Index Elements
challenges.description: Given N and an array of N integers, print all elements with even indices (0, 2, 4, ...).
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Elements at even indices separated by single spaces.

challenges.title: Even Elements
challenges.description: Given N and N integers, print only the even elements in the same order.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: All even elements separated by spaces or an empty line if none.

challenges.title: Greater Than Previous
challenges.description: Given N and a sequence of N integers, print all elements that are strictly greater than the previous element.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Elements that are greater than their previous element, separated by spaces.

challenges.title: First Same Sign Pair
challenges.description: Given N and N integers, find the first pair of adjacent elements that have the same sign (both positive or both negative). Print them. If no such pair exists, print nothing.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Two integers: the first such pair, or empty output if none.

challenges.title: Greater Than Both Neighbours
challenges.description: Given N and N integers, count how many elements are strictly greater than both their neighbors. The first and last elements are not considered.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: count of such elements.

challenges.title: Max Element and Index
challenges.description: Given N and an array, find the maximum value and its index. If there are multiple maxima, print the index of the first one.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Distinct Count in Sorted Array
challenges.description: Given N and a non-decreasing sequence of N integers, determine how many distinct numbers there are.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers in non-decreasing order.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: number of distinct values.

challenges.title: Swap Min and Max
challenges.description: Given N and an array of N distinct integers, swap the positions of the minimum and maximum elements, then print the resulting array.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N distinct integers.
challenges.outputDescription: N integers after swapping min and max.

challenges.title: Equal Pairs
challenges.description: Given N and N integers, count how many unordered pairs (i, j) with i < j have a[i] = a[j].
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: number of equal pairs.

challenges.title: Elements Appearing Once
challenges.description: Given N and N integers, print the elements that appear exactly once, in the same order as in the input.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Elements with frequency 1 separated by spaces, or empty output if none.
